Uh oh.. Could that be the whole problem?  I think I did bend a couple of th=
e pins when I clipped the mute one, and maybe I didn't get them straightene=
d out perfectly.  I would be so proud if I could actually get this working =
again by myself!

Robin

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: psi_resear=
ch<mailto:vilhellm@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Sunday, January 06, 2008 2:16 AM
  Subject: =
[EVP-ITC] Re: Check out what I broke this time


  For me the tricky part w=
as getting the pins lined up to go back into
  the edge connector after the=
 mute pin has been cut /removed. It's easy
  to misalign them and bend one =
by accident. -Bill

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com>, "Robin Searcy Henson"
  <MudPuddleFarm@...> wrote:
  >
  > Thank=
s Joel. I'm not sure that's the problem anymore, though, as
  the leads app=
ear to be intact.
  > 
  >

 new leads at rs for like` $2.00 and get it to work
  > 
  > Robin Henson <=
MudPuddleFarm@...<mailto:MudPuddleFarm@...>> wrote: 
  > 
  > After viewing=
 Mike's RS 12-469 hack video for the fifth time I felt 
  > ready to take t=
he plunge myself, so yesterday while dh was
  picking up 
  > a pizza at Pa=
pa John's I sneaked next door and bought the radio. He 
  > couldn't stop c=
omplaining about how I'd wasted money on a perfectly 
  > good piece of equ=
ipment only to wreck it for my dumb hobby, but
  once 
  > we got home he t=
ook it upon himself to test it and make sure it 
  > worked. For some reaso=
n it really DIDN'T work, so he took it
  back to 
  > RS and exchanged it f=
or another one, and after making sure THAT one 
  > worked he even offered =
to help me with the modification. "No
  thanks" 
  > I told him. "I think I=
 need to do this myself." 
  > 
  > I can't pretend the process went as smo=
othly as I'd hoped, but 
  > finally I was done and making the last turn in=
 the second screw of 
  > the circuit board.. and then.. The whole thing fl=
ew out of my hands 
  > and both battery wires ripped away from their solde=
red ends in the 
  > casing. It was all Bob could do to keep from gleefully=
 yelling "I 
  > knew you were going to break it!" But then I guess he felt=
 bad 
  > because he ran down to Walmart and got a soldering iron and solde=
r 
  > and spent an hour trying to put it all back together for me. 
  > 
 =
 > It's dead as a doornail, and I'm thinking that if I could break it 
  > =
that easily without even knowing how or why, maybe I'm not supposed 
  > to=
 pursue this method (sigh). I guess I'll just think it over and 
  > maybe =
try again later. 
  > 
  > Thanks for all the helpful information though Mi=
ke!
  > 
  > Robin
